business.headline: Big vision, tight margins: Why execution will make or break this BudgetThe direction for Budget 2026 is right, but delivery will decide credibility. In that sense, this is a Budget that excites on paper while simultaneously inviting scrutiny on execution.
Parliament gets Rs 1,492 crore in Budget 2026Parliament has been allocated Rs 1,492 crore in the Union Budget 2026 presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman today.

Macro stability is not to be sniffed at: Sanjeev Sanyal calls Budget 2026 solid, no-nonsenseEconomist and PM's Economic Advisory Council member Sanjeev Sanyal has described the Union Budget 2026 as a "solid, no-nonsense" exercise, arguing that fiscal consolidation and macro stability are its core strengths. He rejected the notion that the absence of "big-bang" announcements made the budget underwhelming.

Govt raises duty-free goods import limit to Rs 75,000 under new baggage rulesA tourist of foreign origin, not being an infant, arriving in India, shall be allowed duty-free clearance of articles up to the value of Rs 25,000. This limit was Rs 15,000 under the Baggage Rules, 2016.

MGNREGA cut, VB-G RAM G gets a boost: Union Budget 2026 signals a rural resetUnder the Budget, VB-G RAM G has been allocated Rs 95,692 crore, positioning it as the single largest component of the Department of Rural Development's spending.

Ashwini Vaishnaw outlines India's high-speed rail future, semiconductor mission 2.0Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw outlined initiatives for developing around 4,000 km high-speed network in India and the next phase of the India Semiconductor Mission, focusing on self-reliance and infrastructure growth.

Budget 2026 ignored 10 key challenges flagged in Economic Survey: ChidambaramFormer Finance Minister P Chidambaram criticised the Union Budget 2026-27 for not addressing core economic challenges flagged in the recent Economic Survey, raising questions on fiscal management and policy priorities.

Hollow, disappointing: Bhupinder Hooda says Budget 2026 left Haryana empty-handedFormer Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda termed the Union Budget 2025–26 "hollow and disappointing," alleging it discriminated against Haryana and offered no relief to the common man.

Budget: India AI mission gets big push. AI to boost governance, says SitharamanPresenting the Union Budget 2026–27, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted the transformative role of artificial intelligence and other emerging technologies. Calling AI a "force multiplier for better governance," she outlined plans for a full-stack, ethical and inclusive AI ecosystem.

Has Budget 2026 silently focused on poll-bound Tamil Nadu and West Bengal?While Tamil Nadu walked away with a Rare Earths Corridor, high-speed rails, cash crop boosts and a push for its key archaeological site, West Bengal too gained in the Union Budget 2026-27 through a freight corridor and high-speed rail line. Both the non-BJP states will be holding Assembly polls in 2026.

The Budget and this analysis. None will change your lifeOnce upon a time, the Union Budget had significance in the everyday life of Indians. Not any more. Yet, out of sheer stubborn habit, we spot the brass band and start swaying senselessly every Budget day.

Budget 2026: Who are the winners and losers?Budget 2026: With a 10% hike in capital expenditure, the government has signalled its continued focus on building roads, railways and logistics. Small businesses also get a boost, as do technology and manufacturing. However, the Budget tightens the screws on wealthy investors and corporates.

Did Budget 2026 announce any tax relief for salaried taxpayers? Here's the answerIncome tax relief is always one of the most closely watched parts of the Union Budget, especially for salaried and middle-class taxpayers. As Budget 2026 was presented in Parliament, many were keen to see whether any changes were announced for those dependent on monthly salaries.

STT hike on F&O trade: What it means for retail investorsThe STT hike raises costs and tempers derivatives frenzy, but experts say the broader market remains stable. For retail investors, the shift signals a move toward smarter, slower and more disciplined trading.

Humpty Dumpty Budget: Mamata Banjerjee fumes over no Bengal mentionWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has strongly criticised the Union Budget 2026-27, labelling it as a 'Humpty-Dumpty Budget' that neglects common people and states like West Bengal.
Markets bleed on Budget day: 3 reasons why Sensex fell 1,500 points todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,546.84 points to close at 80,722.94, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 495.20 points to end at 24,825.45.

Buybacks to be taxed as capital gains: Who gains and who loses?Budget 2026 puts buybacks back in the spotlight, reshaping how India Inc returns cash and how investors respond. But in this new regime, who truly gains and who loses?

Deadline for filing revised IT returns extended to March 31 from Dec 31The time limit for filing revised income tax returns has been extended to March 31 from December 31, on payment of a nominal fee, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed on Sunday while presenting the Union Budget 2026.

What is the Infrastructure Risk Guarantee Fund announced in Budget 2026?Taken together, the Infrastructure Risk Guarantee Fund, higher capital spending and focus on smaller cities point to a more execution-driven approach to infrastructure development.

Budget 2026: International travel to get cheaper as tour package tax cut to 2%Tabling her ninth consecutive Budget in Lok Sabha, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed a steep cut in tax collection at source (TCS) on overseas tour packages from the current 5 and 20 per cent to just 2%

entertainment.headline: Border 2 is my rebirth: Anu Malik gets emotional over film's success In an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, music composer Anu Malik got emotional over the success of his latest release 'Border 2.' He said how the film marks his rebirth.

Suriya dances to Anjala song at Gautham Menon 25 event, Jyotika attends. Watch Suriya and Jyotika attended the Gautham Menon 25 event in Chennai, celebrating the director's 25 years in Tamil cinema. The event marked a memorable reunion with Suriya dancing to the iconic Anjala song, symbolising mended ties and friendship.

Grammys 2026: Chappell Roan pushes fashion limits in daring sheer gown Singer Chappell Roan turned heads on the Grammys red carpet with a revealing burgundy Mugler dress, as she celebrates two major nominations and reflects on her journey in the music industry.

Grammys: Shankar Mahadevan flaunts nominee medal, hangs out with global musician Indian musician Shankar Mahadevan attended the pre-Grammy nominee reception in Los Angeles, where he received his nominee medal and shared moments with global artists ahead of the 2026 Grammy Awards.

Grammy Awards 2026: Lady Gaga, Justin Bieber shine in black on red carpet The 68th annual Grammy Awards have officially kicked off in Los Angeles, bringing a celebratory night of music, star power and major wins across genres, hosted by Trevor Noah for the sixth and final time, airing live on CBS and streaming on Paramount+ Premium.

Filmmaker Steven Spielberg achieves EGOT status after historic Grammy win Filmmaker Steven Spielberg has achieved the rare distinction of EGOT status, securing a Grammy for Best Music Film with his production of Music by John Williams and joining an elite group of multi-award winners.

Grammy Awards 2026 LIVE: Olivia Dean wins the best new artist The 68th Grammy Awards are in full swing in Los Angeles, with heavyweights including Kendrick Lamar, Lady Gaga and Bad Bunny taking centre stage.

Rani Mukerji says Aditya Chopra gave her a reality check to get back to work Rani Mukerji revealed that it was husband Aditya Chopra who reminded her to get back to work. She praised Aditya for being supportive of her career.

Shahid Kapoor: We are not making as many good films as we should Actor Shahid Kapoor opened up on the creative challenges filmmakers face today. He emphasised that the Hindi film industry is falling short when it comes to making truly good films.

Parasakthi OTT release: When and where to watch Sivakarthikeyan's political drama Sivakarthikeyan and Ravi Mohan's Parasakthi will begin streaming on OTT soon. The film also features Atharvaa Murali, Sreeleela, Kulappulli Leela, Prakash Belawadi and others in key roles.

Love is not what you see on Instagram: Karan Kundrra opens up on relationship Karan Kundrra recently reflected on his relationship with Tejasswi Prakash. He emphasised that love is not always what is shown in social media and cinema.

Did Dhadak 2 director Shazia Iqbal call Dhurandhar a sinister film in cryptic post? Dhadak 2 director Shazia Iqbal has indirectly criticised Dhurandhar, referring to it as a sinister film, inciting hate and violence. Dhurandhar features Ranveer Singh in the lead role.

Film body seeks CM Fadnavis' intervention after firing at Rohit Shetty's Juhu home The Indian Film & Television Directors' Association (IFTDA) has condemned the firing incident at Rohit Shetty's residence. The film body has also sought Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's intervention regarding the case.

Rohit Shetty cancels all plans, asks friends to not visit him for next 2 days Rohit Shetty has cancelled all his plans for the next two days following the recent firing incident at his residence. He has also asked close friends not to visit him for the next 48 hours.

It's a wrap for Mirzapur The Film, makers share video from sets. Watch The makers of the upcoming gangster drama 'Mirzapur: The Film' announced the film's wrap with a special video from the sets. The movie is created by Puneet Krishna and directed by Gurmmeet Singh.

Video: Ram Charan, daughter Klin Kaara mobbed at hospital. Fans slam crowd Ram Charan and his two-year-old daughter Klin Kaara were mobbed outside a Hyderabad hospital. They were visiting Upasana Konidela and the newborn twins.

Scenes from a Situationship: Vaibhav Munjal film offers a fresh take on modern love Vaibhav Munjal's directorial debut presents 'Scenes from a Situationship', a candid look at contemporary relationships. It captures the complexities and contradictions experienced by young urban couples.

D55: Sreeleela to star opposite Dhanush in Rajkumar Periasamy film The makers of the tentatively titled 'D55' have announced that Sreeleela has been roped in to star opposite Dhanush in director Rajkumar Periasamy's next film.

Rashmika-Vijay to marry in Udaipur as per viral video claim? Here's the truth A viral video by a vlogger claimed that Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are set to marry on February 2. However, no official confirmation is there from the two actors.

general news.headline: Pakistan to boycott India match at T20 World Cup, ICC warns of falloutPakistan will play the T20 World Cup but will not play their match against India, confirmed the country's government on Sunday, February 1. Pakistan were set to clash against India on February 15 in Colombo.

Big vision, tight margins: Why execution will make or break this BudgetThe direction for Budget 2026 is right, but delivery will decide credibility. In that sense, this is a Budget that excites on paper while simultaneously inviting scrutiny on execution.

Why India's EU-FTA Brahmastra has both Pak and Bangladesh rattledExporters in both Pakistan and Bangladesh have warned that the India-EU Free Trade Agreement could erode their hard-won advantages in the lucrative European market as Indian goods gain duty-free access. Hinting towards India's Operation Sindoor, an office-bearer of a Pakistani traders' association said that Delhi "has now opened an economic front" against Pakistan.

Grammy Awards 2026 LIVE: Olivia Dean wins the best new artistThe 68th Grammy Awards are in full swing in Los Angeles, with heavyweights including Kendrick Lamar, Lady Gaga and Bad Bunny taking centre stage.

The Budget and this analysis. None will change your lifeOnce upon a time, the Union Budget had significance in the everyday life of Indians. Not any more. Yet, out of sheer stubborn habit, we spot the brass band and start swaying senselessly every Budget day.

Grammys: Shankar Mahadevan flaunts nominee medal, hangs out with global musicianIndian musician Shankar Mahadevan attended the pre-Grammy nominee reception in Los Angeles, where he received his nominee medal and shared moments with global artists ahead of the 2026 Grammy Awards.

Will ICC punish Pakistan for boycotting India at T20 World Cup?The International Cricket Council has reportedly not received any official or written communication from the Pakistan Cricket Board regarding its decision to boycott India in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. Sources told India Today that the ICC would consider any action or sanctions only after the PCB formally communicates its position.

Dense fog engulfs Delhi-NCR, airport warns of flight delays as visibility dropsDelhi-NCR was enveloped in thick smog on Monday, which sharply reduced visibility across the city and led Delhi airport to operate under CAT III conditions, while several other airports in north India, including Sarsawa, Agra, Bareilly, Hindon in Uttar Pradesh and Bhatinda in Punjab, recorded zero visibility.

Grammy Awards 2026: Lady Gaga, Justin Bieber shine in black on red carpetThe 68th annual Grammy Awards have officially kicked off in Los Angeles, bringing a celebratory night of music, star power and major wins across genres, hosted by Trevor Noah for the sixth and final time, airing live on CBS and streaming on Paramount+ Premium.

Why the biggest Baloch attack in decades is a wake-up call for US, ChinaA series of coordinated attacks by BLA rebels across Pakistan's province of Balochistan is a wake-up call to both the US and China. Both countries have high stakes in Balochistan centred around resource extraction and access to alternative trade routes. These moves are fuelling the wave of BLA attacks that have struck Pakistan in the past few years.

Big infra, AI data centres boost, massive defence hike, cheaper cancer drugsInfra, tech and manufacturing take the spotlight, but the market reaction adds a twist. Read on for a clearer view of what stood out in Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget 2026 presentation.

Filmmaker Steven Spielberg achieves EGOT status after historic Grammy winFilmmaker Steven Spielberg has achieved the rare distinction of EGOT status, securing a Grammy for Best Music Film with his production of Music by John Williams and joining an elite group of multi-award winners.

Bengaluru schoolkids bring fruits for teacher after she mentions liking themAn Instagram video shared by Deepali Dahikamble, a Teach For India fellow based in Bengaluru, is winning hearts for capturing the generous gesture of her students.

Momo addiction drives 14-year-old in UP to steal family jewellery worth lakhsThe theft came to light when the family checked their almirah for stored jewellery and found several ornaments missing, prompting a police complaint and search for the momo vendor.

Balance of power is...: Elon Musk as IMF puts India ahead of US in global growthElon Musk said the 'balance of power is changing,' highlighting an eastward shift in the global economy amid trade tensions and moderating inflation trends.

Salman Agha reacts after Pakistan's decision to boycott T20 World Cup game vs IndiaPakistan skipper Salman Agha reacted to the government's decision to boycott their T20 World Cup match against India. The Government of Pakistan confirmed that the team would participate in the tournament but would not take the field against India.

40s and laid off: What does this budget have for you?While Budget 2026, presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, bets big on education and skilling, it offers limited answers for mid-career professionals in India facing layoffs, AI-led disruption and growing job insecurity.

High-speed rails, rare earths corridors, AI data centres: Which state got whatBudget 2026 unveils major projects for states including West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Assam, Uttar Pradesh, and more. Here's a state-wise look.

Miyas can't live in peace here, they will only leave if we create trouble: Assam CMAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday asserted that Bengali-speaking Muslims, known as 'Miyas,' would face challenges as long as he is in power, linking his stance to alleged illegal migration and demographic changes in the state.

Man rapes cow in Madhya Pradesh town, locals torch shops and vehicles in protestTensions escalated in Madhya Pradesh's Betul district after a video circulated online allegedly showing a man sexually assaulting a cow. The footage triggered outrage among locals, leading to arson and vandalism targeting shops and vehicles.

Video: Man blows kisses at woman seated in car, tails her; 2 arrestedTwo men have been arrested in Noida after one of them allegedly blew kisses at a woman sitting inside a car and then trailed her vehicle in a viral video.

Alcaraz crowns Career Slam dream, keeps Djokovic's historic 25th on holdAustralian Open 2026: Carlos Alcaraz became the youngest man to complete the Career Grand Slam after defeating 10-time champion Novak Djokovic 2-6, 6-2, 6-3, 7-5 on Sunday at the Rod Laver Arena. The loss also prolonged Djokovic's wait for a record-extending 25th Grand Slam title.

Has Budget 2026 silently focused on poll-bound Tamil Nadu and West Bengal?While Tamil Nadu walked away with a Rare Earths Corridor, high-speed rails, cash crop boosts and a push for its key archaeological site, West Bengal too gained in the Union Budget 2026-27 through a freight corridor and high-speed rail line. Both the non-BJP states will be holding Assembly polls in 2026.

Musk blames smear campaign after emails reveal his planned visit to Epstein islandThe latest controversy comes after the latest records released by the US Justice Department show that Musk tried to arrange several meetings with Epstein and sought an invitation to a major gathering on his private island.

sports.headline: Gavaskar trolls Pakistan's India boycott: Like their cricketers, a U-turn awaits Sunil Gavaskar took a swipe at Pakistan's India boycott call at the T20 World Cup, saying mounting pressure could force a U-turn, just as their cricketers have often reversed retirement decisions.

ICC warns Pakistan of long-term implications over boycotting T20 WC clash vs India The International Cricket Council (ICC) has reacted strongly against Pakistan's government's decision to boycott their match against India in the T20 World Cup 2026. ICC has warned the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) about large scale implications of their decision, saying that their stance is difficult to reconcile.

ICC must impose strict sanctions on Pakistan for boycotting India game: Gavaskar Sunil Gavaskar has urged the ICC to take strict action against Pakistan for boycotting India in the T20 World Cup 2026. The move could lead to severe penalties affecting Pakistan's cricketing future and its ICC tournament hosting rights.

India to fly to SL, do usual pre-match duties despite Pakistan boycott: Sources T20 World Cup 2026: According to sources, the Indian team will travel to Sri Lanka, complete their scheduled pre-match preparations, and await the match referee's decision should Pakistan fail to take the field following the news of their boycott of the game against India.

Salman Agha reacts after Pakistan's decision to boycott T20 World Cup game vs India Pakistan skipper Salman Agha reacted to the government's decision to boycott their T20 World Cup match against India. The Government of Pakistan confirmed that the team would participate in the tournament but would not take the field against India.

Will ICC punish Pakistan for boycotting India at T20 World Cup? The International Cricket Council has reportedly not received any official or written communication from the Pakistan Cricket Board regarding its decision to boycott India in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. Sources told India Today that the ICC would consider any action or sanctions only after the PCB formally communicates its position.

U-19 World Cup: India thrash Pakistan by 58 runs to seal semi-final berth Under 19 World Cup, IND vs PAK: India qualified for the semi-finals of the Under-19 World Cup 2026 after beating Pakistan by 58 runs at Queens Sports Club in Bulawayo. Asked to chase a target of 253 runs, Pakistan got all out for 194 runs in 46.2 overs.

Carlos Alcaraz doffs hat to Novak Djokovic for silencing doubters Australian Open: Carlos Alcaraz heaped praise on Novak Djokovic for proving the naysayers wrong by qualifying for the final at Melbourne. Djokovic beat Jannik Sinner in the semis, but lost to Alcaraz in four sets in the final.

Novak Djokovic refuses to give up on 25th Grand Slam dream: I always believe I can Novak Djokovic is not ready to walk away from his pursuit of a record-extending 25th Grand Slam title, even after suffering his first-ever defeat in an Australian Open final on Sunday.

Carlos Alcaraz sounds alarm to his doubters after historic Australian Open win Australian Open 2026: Carlos Alcaraz hit back at his critics after becoming the youngest man to complete the Career Grand Slam, defeating Novak Djokovic in four sets to win the Australian Open.

Pakistan to boycott India match at T20 World Cup, ICC warns of fallout Pakistan will play the T20 World Cup but will not play their match against India, confirmed the country's government on Sunday, February 1. Pakistan were set to clash against India on February 15 in Colombo.

Pakistan warm up for T20 World Cup with historic T20I series clean sweep vs AustraliaPAK vs AUS, 3rd T20I: Salman Ali Agha's Pakistan hammered Australia by 111 runs in the third T20I to complete a 3-0 whitewash as a big boost before the T20 World Cup.

Karnataka, Andhra, Jharkhand, J&K through to quarterfinals with MumbaiKarnataka, Andhra, Jharkhand and Jammu & Kashmir sealed their places in the Ranji Trophy quarterfinals on a dramatic final day of group-stage action, joining already-qualified Mumbai in the knockout round.

Novak Djokovic's moving shoutout to Rafael Nadal steals spotlight after Aus Open finalNovak Djokovic paid an emotional tribute to Rafael Nadal during the Australian Open ceremony, honouring the 22-time Grand Slam champion who watched from the stands. Despite dominating the first set, Djokovic ultimately fell to Carlos Alcaraz, who completed a Career Grand Slam.

Carlos Alcaraz breaks 88-year record, rewrites history with Career Grand SlamCarlos Alcaraz ended an 88-year wait on Sunday night, completing a career Grand Slam with a four-set victory over Novak Djokovic in the Australian Open final. Aged 22 years and 272 days, the Spaniard became the youngest man in history to win all four major singles titles, surpassing the record set by Don Budge in 1938.

DC-W vs UPW, Live Score: Delhi qualify for Eliminator with 5-wicket victoryDC vs UPW, WPL 2026 Live Score: UP Warriorz have been knocked out of the tournament as they needed at least 157 runs to stay in the hunt. Delhi Capitals, on the other hand, have qualified for the Eliminator with a 5-wicket victory.

Djokovic leaves retirement call to the almighty after Australian Open final defeatAustralian Open: Novak Djokovic hinted at an uncertain future after his Australian Open final loss to Carlos Alcaraz, admitting he never expected to be back at a Grand Slam closing ceremony at this stage of his career.

India, Pakistan captains continue no handshake policy in Under-19 World Cup 2026India and Pakistan continued their no-handshake policy during their Super Six match in the Under-19 World Cup 2026. The two teams have not done handshakes since the Asia Cup 2025.

Alcaraz crowns Career Slam dream, keeps Djokovic's historic 25th on holdAustralian Open 2026: Carlos Alcaraz became the youngest man to complete the Career Grand Slam after defeating 10-time champion Novak Djokovic 2-6, 6-2, 6-3, 7-5 on Sunday at the Rod Laver Arena. The loss also prolonged Djokovic's wait for a record-extending 25th Grand Slam title.

Devika Sihag secures maiden Super 300 title at Thailand MastersYoung Indian shuttler Devika Sihag clinched her first BWF Super 300 title at the Thailand Masters. Sihag was leading 21-8, 6-3 when her opponent Goh Jin Wei pulled out due to a hamstring injury.

Union Budget allocates Rs 500 crore to boost sports goods manufacturing in IndiaIndia's sports sector received a major boost in the Union Budget, with a first-ever Rs 500 crore allocation for sports goods manufacturing and a sharp rise in overall funding.

Let off twice, but Vaibhav Suryavanshi fails to cash in; another failure vs PakU19 World Cup 2026: Vaibhav Suryavanshi struggled to again make an impact against Pakistan, scoring 30 off 22 balls before Mohammad Sayyam accounted for his wicket in the Super 6 match in Bulawayo.

Union Budget 2026: Government proposes Khelo India mission to transform sportsThe government on Sunday proposed the launch of a Khelo India mission aimed at strengthening India's sports ecosystem over the next decade, expanding the scope of the existing programme beyond talent identification to include systemic development of infrastructure, coaching and support systems.

No T20 World Cup, no problem. Bangladesh rolls out their own domestic T20 CupFollowing the ICC's decision to replace Bangladesh with Scotland for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, the Bangladesh Cricket Board has moved swiftly to address the gap, announcing the launch of a new domestic tournament—the ODOMMO Bangladesh T20 Cup 2026.

IND vs PAK, Highlights: India hammer Pakistan, storm into semi-final unbeatenIND vs PAK, U-19 World Cup Highlights: India have made their way through to the semi-final after beating Pakistan by 58 runs in the Super 6 clash on Sunday in Bulawayo. Pakistan, on the other hand, failed to qualify for the semis.

Carlos Alcaraz lifts trophy, Novak Djokovic thanks fans after an epic finalAustralian Open men's singles Highlights: Carlos Alcaraz has defeated Novak Djokovic in four sets to win his maiden Australian Open title, becoming the youngest man in the Open Era to complete the Career Grand Slam. Meanwhile, Novak Djokovic lost his first-ever Australian Open title.

Ishan Kishan grabs the Tatkal ticket. Is Sanju Samson back on the waiting list?Has one dominant T20I series reshaped India's batting hierarchy? Ishan Kishan's surge has brought urgency and clarity, while Sanju Samson's struggles have reopened familiar questions on the eve of a T20 World Cup title defence.

If Abhishek doesn't get you, Ishan will: NZ skipper Santner on India's Trivandrum showIshan Kishan's Thiruvananthapuram hundred left New Zealand out of options, forcing Mitchell Santner to put his hands up. With the T20 World Cup days away, India's batting firepower is peaking at the right time.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz: Melbourne Park braces for ultimate Difficult vs Impossible clashAustralian Open: Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic are all set for a blockbuster final at Melbourne Park on Sunday. While Djokovic is looking for his 25th Grand Slam title, Alcaraz is one win away from a Career Slam.

Watch: Chelsea vs West Ham thriller ends in ugly brawl as Todibo strangles Joao PedroChelsea completed a stunning 3–2 comeback against West Ham at Stamford Bridge, but victory was eclipsed by chaos. A stoppage-time brawl ended with Todibo sent off for throttling Joao Pedro, turning a thriller into flashpoint.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
